data.text: @DustyReign @TeaCambridges @topKinss It was my general opinion, not addressed to you directly. 🙂

@RoyaleVision @TeaCambridges @topKinss I use Kate on twitter only bc it has fewer characters. If I have the space to type Duchess of Cambridge, I will. And DOC could be at least 3 people. I try to avoid KM or Middleton since that’s not her name anymore but she does go by Kate privately.
@RoyaleVision @princesspleats @topKinss @TeaCambridges If no one other than the media called her Kate, it would have been corrected a long time ago.
@princesspleats @topKinss @TeaCambridges are we and the media children ? 🤔

@DustyReign @TeaCambridges @topKinss The fact is her name is Catherine, so why not use it ? The Queen, as a child signed and was called "Lilibet", should she be addressed as Queen Lilibet by the media ?

@topKinss @TeaCambridges @RoyaleVision Pip and Squeak story was not at Marlborough but St Andrew’s (the prep school before Marlborough not the university). Class guinea pigs were the source of nicknames

@RoyaleVision @TeaCambridges @topKinss What I was thinking about was a different vid, it was one of the press vid snippets, or maybe KP, on Twitter from an event. And he’d said it to get her attention if memory serves.

@DustyReign @TeaCambridges @topKinss In their engagement interview in 2010 William did say once Kate, and never again. Maybe he wanted to look more "normal" (by then she was known as "Kate", thanks to media).
@RoyaleVision @TeaCambridges @topKinss There was a vid of W&K at a joint event and Will called her Kate. It was a cple yrs ago if memory serves.

@TeaCambridges @RoyaleVision @topKinss People magazine after wedding had a story from American women that went to St Andrew’s with them, story had picture of happy birthday note signed Kate. W has referred to her as Kate too in informal settings
@TeaCambridges @topKinss She was Catherine for teachers, parent, fiends at the time. "Kate" started when media learnt she was with William, with nasty "Kiss me Kate" headlines.
